trans-unit.source: Change: EMAIL_IMAP_MAILBOXES renamed to EMAIL_IMAP_SECRETS because of security (we don't want to show IMAP configuration in Django debug mode)

trans-unit.source: Firstly, have to specify django_imap_backend.ImapBackend as your EMAIL_BACKEND in settings.py. Than you need to add configuration for your mailboxes in EMAIL_IMAP_SECRETS list. Your's setings.py should looks like this:
trans-unit.target: ì²«ì§¸, ì§€ì •í•´ì•¼ django_imap_backend.ImapBackend ì„ ë‹¹ì‹ ìœ¼ë¡œ EMAIL_BACKEND ì—ì„œ settings.py . EMAIL_IMAP_SECRETS ëª©ë¡ì— í¸ì§€í•¨ êµ¬ì„±ì„ ì¶”ê°€í•´ì•¼ í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤. ë‹¹ì‹ ì˜ setings.py ëŠ” ë‹¤ìŒê³¼ ê°™ì•„ì•¼í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤ :

trans-unit.source: IMAP back-end for django.core.mail package, aimed for uploading messages to specif mailboxes, instead of sending it over SMTP (or other Django email backend). Useful for debugging without fancy services like mailtrap.io. Library is capable of uploading messages to multiple accounts at once (one email to multiple mailboxes or accounts).

trans-unit.source: IMAP backend for Django mail package
trans-unit.target: Django ë©”ì¼ íŒ¨í‚¤ì§€ ìš© IMAP ë°±ì—”ë“œ

trans-unit.source: In last few months I worked on project where we have to send a lot of emails to different mailboxes. We used fake (and after migration real) e-mail addresses in our staging environment. It was hard to debug these messages without services like mailtrap (for which we just didn't want to pay, even it's a pretty cool product, client's budget is client's budged).
